message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.DS 

This paper deals with the problem of training models with hard-to-optimize metrics, which is a common issue in machine learning. The proposed approach involves expressing the metric as a function of easy-to-optimize surrogates and solving the optimization problem over a relaxed surrogate space. This approach is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), natural language processing (cs.CL), and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
